pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:5.1: 67. The training rule on covered heads
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people whose heads were covered. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:7.2: “‘I will not give teachings to anyone whose head is covered and who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:8.2: the upper robe also covers the head is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:9.1: One should not give teachings to anyone whose head is covered and who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:9.2: If a monk out of disrespect gives teachings to someone whose head is covered and who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:10.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:11.1: The seventh training rule is finished.
